channel.title: Comments on: Nginx 1.7.8 – Fixes 200ms Delay With SPDY

item.title: By: Kevin Sweet
item.dc:creator: Kevin Sweet
item.description:
Wow, thanks so much for writing this article! I finally got to put SPDY on a server, and noticed that the TTFB was actually pretty bad. After Googling for awhile I stumbled onto this. I was extremely skeptical that this was actually my problem. But I was using Nginx 1.6 so I figured I might as well upgrade to 1.7. As soon as I did, webpagetest started giving me As for TTFB. Crazy.
Thanks again!
item.content:encoded:
Wow, thanks so much for writing this article! I finally got to put SPDY on a server, and noticed that the TTFB was actually pretty bad. After Googling for awhile I stumbled onto this. I was extremely skeptical that this was actually my problem. But I was using Nginx 1.6 so I figured I might as well upgrade to 1.7. As soon as I did, webpagetest started giving me As for TTFB. Crazy.

Thanks again!

item.title: By: Rik Ske
item.dc:creator: Rik Ske
item.description:
I forget to thank you for the article. So thank you for that. Btw The Nginx team is going to evaluate the case, see:
"We will discuss merging this code to 1.6 for the next release but we don't have a schedule for 1.6.3 yet." - Maxim Konovalov
item.content:encoded:
I forget to thank you for the article. So thank you for that.
Btw The Nginx team is going to evaluate the case, see:

“We will discuss merging this code to 1.6 for the next release but we
don’t have a schedule for 1.6.3 yet.” – Maxim Konovalov

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2014/12/03/nginx-1-7-8-fixes-200ms-delay-with-spdy/#comment-4282">Rik Ske</a>.
I don't know what the Nginx back porting policy is ( or if they have one ). I agree that it would definitely be helpful for those still using the 1.6.x versions.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Rik Ske.

I don’t know what the Nginx back porting policy is ( or if they have one ). I agree that it would definitely be helpful for those still using the 1.6.x versions.

item.title: By: Rik Ske
item.dc:creator: Rik Ske
item.description:
Thanks Joseph for your fast reply,
I have asked the Nginx developers to make a patch for Nginx 1.6. This is a major loss of function and a critical bug, if you ask me, because the existing 1.6. tcp_nodelay won't work as it should be.
item.content:encoded:
Thanks Joseph for your fast reply,

I have asked the Nginx developers to make a patch for Nginx 1.6.
This is a major loss of function and a critical bug, if you ask me,
because the existing 1.6. tcp_nodelay won’t work as it should be.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2014/12/03/nginx-1-7-8-fixes-200ms-delay-with-spdy/#comment-4280">Rik Ske</a>.
Correct, you'll need 1.7.8 or newer in order to fix that.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Rik Ske.

Correct, you’ll need 1.7.8 or newer in order to fix that.

item.title: By: Rik Ske
item.dc:creator: Rik Ske
item.description: I'm having the same problem as described in this article. "It applies to all versions up to 1.7.8'' unfortunately. Reference: http://mailman.nginx.org/pipermail/nginx/2015-February/046651.html
item.content:encoded:
I’m having the same problem as described in this article.
“It applies to all versions up to 1.7.8” unfortunately.
Reference: http://mailman.nginx.org/pipermail/nginx/2015-February/046651.html

item.title: By: Performance Calendar » Blast from the Past: Impact of TCP Components on Time to First Byte
item.dc:creator: Performance Calendar » Blast from the Past: Impact of TCP Components on Time to First Byte
item.description: […] Now that we have seen why the components of TCP lets see how their interaction causes a deadlock.Instead of a contrived example to demonstrate this classic problem , lets take a look at this problem in the wild. The thread has a lot of details from WPT waterfalls to tcpdumps. The TLDR can be read here if you are impatient […]
item.content:encoded: […] Now that we have seen why the components of TCP lets see how their interaction causes a deadlock.Instead of a contrived example to demonstrate this classic problem , lets take a look at this problem in the wild. The thread has a lot of details from WPT waterfalls to tcpdumps. The TLDR can be read here if you are impatient […]

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2014/12/03/nginx-1-7-8-fixes-200ms-delay-with-spdy/#comment-4277">Rodrigo Montoro</a>.
I don't think that I ever tested Nginx 1.6.2. I was focused on recent versions.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Rodrigo Montoro.

I don’t think that I ever tested Nginx 1.6.2. I was focused on recent versions.

item.title: By: Rodrigo Montoro
item.dc:creator: Rodrigo Montoro
item.description:
Did you test 1.6.2 version if it has same delay problem ?
Thanks for sharing this =)
item.content:encoded:
Did you test 1.6.2 version if it has same delay problem ?

Thanks for sharing this =)
